intro: Agalinis tenella, commonly known as the slender bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and pond edges, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils. Its leaves are opposite, linear, and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Agalinis tenella is an annual plant that blooms from late spring to early summer, playing a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
